This is actually my first review on this, so please bear with me.
RElife is a very unique, outside the box kind of anime. It stood out during its release season (mainly due to the fact that all the episodes were released at once.) and will probably still stand out well after its debut.
Story: I love how the objective is put out at the very first episode. It also gives a feel of how this show would be; fast paced with a comedic yet serious tone. I absolutely loved the story in this. 
Animation: Nothing much to say for the animation besides it being great andcomplementing the tone of the series.\n\n
Characters: Probably the most memorable part of this anime are its characters. They all have their uniqur traits which in turn helped make the episodes all the more enjoyable.\n\n
All in all, a great anime, defimetly will stay with you and tempt you to watch it over again.\n
Rate: 9

Relife is really cute.  The main guy is well, a main guy.  He’s down and out, but that’s because of problems in his first life where he tried to be a nice guy and it backfired on him. Still, he’s interesting enough, and watching his older life and his current one clash.  Watching someone try to go back to high school.  It’s nice to see acknowledgement that he’s older and thus will tackle certain situations differently.  
The main problem with this story is that he mostly doesn’t come across half the time as the main character.  In fact, theperson with the most hang-ups is Rena.  I really ended up not liking her.  I kinda liked that she understood what her own problems were and that she was being an idiot, but watching her just fail because of her situations makes her a really annoying character to deal with. 


Plus, there’s a few too many grownups in the story.  That might sound weird, but if I go into more, I go into spoilers.  


Now if this had the main character dealing with individual stories in some way that fleshed out the class more and didn’t make the series seem more like the “Rena problem of the day” thing, I think I would have liked it more.  But overall it is a rather cute and harmless bit of fluff to watch. Though the whole “let’s deal with trauma by putting him in high school” seems really stupid.

A very entertaining and at times moving romance, although not without its flaws.
Relife does a pretty good job balancing out comedy, entertainment and the more serious moments. The humour is usually spot on, although there were some jokes which were dragged on too long during the first few episodes. The series also delves into more serious topics really well like social isolation and self esteem. Relife was usually well paced, especially towards the later episodes where it focused on specific characters and their challenges.
The characters are all very likeable and relatable. Each character gets their moment in the spotlight, so we get to learn moreabout them and their insecurities. Arata, (a 27 year old who takes a pill to turn 10 years younger) for example at first seems to be a young adult struggling to find a job after he quit his previous one, but later on we learn more about his past and how it has continued to affect him now. Although some of the character’s development felt rushed as we learn nearly everything about them all at once without getting to know them prior to that episode.


The stories of the characters are presented really well. Most episodes focus on a specific character and their personal struggles, and how they cope with it. Whether it’s about a crush, or coming to terms with the past, the challenges the characters face makes them more relatable and makes us care about them even more. 


Relife is a really good romance with lots of entertaining moments, although there are times the quality drops. Nevertheless Relife has some fantastic characters and stories to tell, and is well worth watching.


Any constructive feedback is appreciated :)

In my opinion, this review contains minor spoilers, do read with that in mind. Also, I didn't read the Manga which apparently existed, so this review will be based on the Anime only.
For starters, I have to say, this was a series that hit really close to home. 
Although I didn't end up like any of the characters, but it really makes me feel my age (despite only 24, which is at least 3 years younger than main characters). 
As for artwork: I don't think it was really beautiful like Shinkai Makoto's work, but it was really close to real life. There's a clear reasonwhy I made this comparison, you will know why when you run through it.

As for animation: There was hardly anything to say about animation. However, the image impression and how everything moved at important scenes was really well matched with the scene. 

Which should be why I give Art and Animation another 10. 


For story line, 

As I mentioned above, it hits close to home. Although I didn't have problems with finding a job, and never fell that hard, it hits really close to home. Although I can't quite express how that is, I can say overall story line hits me right the spot it hurts the most.

I am also the kind to predict how the story is going to come out to be, so I had predictions through out this series like usual too. However, I was greeted with surprises for almost all episodes. First, I didn't predict the plot to go with "rehabilitation program" but something more like somehow go back to highschool life. Then later episodes give me some surprises too as my prediction gets up turned every time. 


While portraying a great school life with fun and laughter, story line still stick with the gloomier part of the plot and keeps reminding both characters and audiences. But then still make you forget, or at least realize it. 


Lastly, as for the end, although my predictions for earlier parts were all wrong and upturned, my prediction of the end was spot on. All I can say is that it's not anything like Shinkai Makoto at all.


For Sound and Music, I realize almost right away that the music tracks are 2000s and 1990s music. It really fits main character as he was 27. A great attention to details, I would say. 


Overall, this was a good series I highly recommend it to anyone who is working in their first 5 years or are having trouble at work or finding one.


P/S: 

I'm not used to writing anything but argument about history so you might find it hard to understand. That's why I hardly write any reviews. But this one series made me want to spend 1 hour to write this review, even though it was late. From that, I suppose you can say how good this series is.

Story: 4 / 10
Yoake approaches a part-time worker Arata and asks him if he wants to re-do a year of his high school life. There's a lot of things that could be done with this premise, but nothing is done and instead the show opts for a typical slice of life melodrama with some romance I suppose. The dialogue is awkward even for an anime, the drama itself is rather stupid and at least to me is not entertaining. It's a thing I've seen in other anime where the drama is caused by a partial or complete lack of communication, one other example of thisbeing Citrus. This is the most annoying type of drama because it is simply solved if the characters were to stop for a minute and have a decent conversation with each other, but if they did that, we wouldn't have an anime. It's weakly constructed drama that falls apart very easily if the characters were to take basic actions and for that reason, it's not entertaining to watch.


Characters: 3 / 10


Again, there's nothing spectacular going on here. You have a romantically dense guy who is happy the majority of the time and unaware of one of how one of the females who is his friend, who is aggressive and causes most of the drama in the show btw, is attracted to him. Apart from those two, the main character, despite going to college and grad school, can't pass some high-school level tests and is thus in the dumbass role, the main female character is emotionally dead for the most part and struggles to understand what her classmates are saying and has a hard time communicating with them (sounds like a real-life mental illness), and every other character is just a tag-along that gets serious when they need to and is otherwise just there for comedic relief occasionally. Tamarai and her two guys are so irrelevant it's not even funny. 


All of these characters are so cliche. It makes watching them rather annoying at times, and the comedy style gets boring after a while. The main character is secretly 27 and as such, sometimes, he gives platitudes appropriate to the situation, but they're the most bland messages ever. Things like "Don't give up," and then they're followed up by a flashback of an experience in his life.


Art & Sound: 4 / 10


Nothing special. In fact, the animation is bland and the OST is not memorable at all. I barely even noticed the music that was playing most of the time.


Overall: 4 / 10


The anime is just lackluster. The main character is essentially given in a pill form a life changing experience and the writers opt to have this man go through a slice of life high school experience and occasionally reference the fact that he's 27. Other than that, he's nothing more than the involved, bland high school anime protagonist that you'll see in a lot of other high school dramas. I felt like I wasted my time watching this anime and if I were you, I'd watch the first two episodes to see if the comedy is up your alley, and if it's even remotely boring, skip the anime altogether. Hell, you don't even need to watch the second episode, just watch the first.

Most of the around 13 episodes anime that I have seen so far had one thing in common ; eacch of them would suck us in at about the five episode mark.
So I expected something big to happen , I kept expecting , until pretty much nothing came up, so I thought that this was some boring romantic slice of life anime.
I even started seeking the episodes and the scenes in which especially kariu cries and whines.
But towards the end I was shocked to find that I was actually interested in the story and what would happen.
I read the synopsis, thought it would be likethe english movie 17 again , but the starting pace wasnt maintained.\n\n
And then it completely took over me towards  the end and I loved it.\n
Especially there are huge twists at the end , leaving you \n\n
What now??\n
I'm pretty sure that anyone who sees this would want a second season.\n
This is surely one of the must see anime of 2016 , if romance in school is the kind of thing you are into , then this is the anime for you but with certain twists and turns.\n\n
The anime is packed with comedy and usually focuses on the mindsets of teenagers.

ReLIFE "Man failing in life signs up for lab experiment that make him a 17 year old school student again" the premise of the show was enough to tell me this was going to be an interesting anime.
For those of you that are still confused this show is NOT a time travel anime. Everything happens in real time. The protagonist eats a pill instead of using a machine.
I honestly didn't know what to expect from this anime as this "becoming a kid" stuff has never been tackled before. I was half expecting some dark seinan shit to go down but it turned out to bea slice of life rom-com instead.(Not that I'm complaining) One of the characters is a bit cringing BUT that doesn't stop the show from having one of the most unique love confessions of all time! All I can say is I did not see it coming at all.\n\n
The anime does a good job of portraying a grown up in a classroom and how outdated he feels by the current generation and the differences between a school life and working life. All in all, I really enjoyed this anime and really hope a 2nd season is on the way

First things first. My "reviews" system is explained on a blog entry. Which can be found through my profile.
------
✦Story
A very bittersweet and melancholic story about a man who got screwed up by ugly "adults" and rotten society, which made him to become NEET and was a given to relive his high school experience.
I did enjoy this story quite a lot, maybe it wasn't as amazing, but I did love all the emotions that went through there. The progression and growth of the story was as well quite  bliss to look at. Many bittersweet moments and with a really satisfying and cute way to wrapthings up. Lot of great dialogues and quotes.. ah.. kinda sad that words don't really affect me anymore in positive way. Otherwise Anime would give so much more strength in life. But nevertheless I did enjoy the story aspect of this Anime, it was sweet, sad and quite beautiful.


✦Art & Sound

It was good but nothing special. Nothing else to comment regarding art.


As for OST & Music, I did love many endings. But the OST felt really odd. It had strong presence which I did like quite a lot, but the issue with OST I had, was that it felt really all over the place and inconsistent. As if they crammed possible as much artist they could into one show. A way to self-promote. But nevertheless there were bunch of OST I liked and loved some ending songs. Whilst opening, I cannot even remember.


✦Character

MC being some "NEET?" More like really good person who cares and is able to manage himself got screwed over by corrupted human trash. Funny how "adults" are often described as lying rotten pigs who only think how to get more money or step over someone and if they don't like someone or honesty and straightforwardness then they use their position to pressure peers or even blackmail. And outcome in this Anime was shown great. I mean I personally would also disagree with deception, lies, using  others for self-profit etc... but I would end up more likely like that woman. As I don't really have the kind and strength trait like the main character of this show.


Anyhow.. did love Chizuru as well a lot.. hurt person with a strong sense of mystery and "weirdness"  love such people. They mostly quiet which is a strong charm point but also in a sense very weak and have really important values. Her emotions were really suppressed, but once they leaked, it was such a nice feeling..


The "observers" were odd but very pretentious.. I hate people "acting" ... they are simply such fake and I find it moronic how society is grown by such acting. Being "self" is most important IMO. Not putting up fake smile and personality to have an "image" . For such bs., go in theater or become an actor.


Also bunch of really nice and cute sidekicks. Although cannot be bothered to comment them.


✦Enjoyment & Overall

It started good, but then the emotions over time became stronger and the really sweet way to wrap things up was another point to raise score for me. Nevertheless as mentioned at the start, it was very bittersweet melancholic Anime, which is probably the thing I loved about the most.

The short review: Read the manga instead.
Story: Adapted from some source material with some obvious love and nuance put into it, unfortunately this 13 episode anime only ends up as glorified setup with no resolution. Instead of rewriting the source material to fit in the season's run, they instead chose to shove the HUGE amount of plot into a 4 episode OVA. To do this, they had to drop large plot points and emotional moments, and the story suffers for it. 
Creep Factor: With a very tricky setup of an adult male hanging out with high schoolers, it's staggeringly clean of major skeeze. The worstof it is a few leers at the high school girls, but it's acknowledged as icky and chastised. Largely the relationships between the 21 Jump Street characters is paternal or uninvolved. 


Art: Easily the weakest point as the art style doesn't lend well to the story being told. The transformation between adult and high school versions of these characters is framed to be dramatic, but in practice the versions are drawn nearly identical. There was also a particularly hilarious moment where the dialogue was saying "Wow, he's so strong, how did he get so built!" and as the character does a loving, slow-mo pan over the character, it's revealed he's drawn with the same stick thing character model as every single other character. The animation itself is rudimentary and looks pretty cheap, relying heavily on visual tropes and loops to cut frames. There are a few good visual gags, Chizuru's smile being a good example with some great timing at points.


Sound: There wasn't much about the in-episode music to write about. It was largely stock piano noodling. I did had a lot of fun with the ending credits music, recognizing a lot of them from my j-pop days. It took me an embarrassing amount of time to realize that they were being played because they were "oldies". Whuf, show. Don't mock my teenage Hyde obsession. Rude. 


Overall: Issues like these are what frustrate me with anime a lot. Trying to adapt large breadths of work into short series shows. I have no idea if the original plan was to condense the last half into the OVA, or if they had intentions to do a second full season but since is what they released, it doesn't matter much. It's this sort of bad pacing and let-down ending that drove me away from anime the first time round. Disappointing.

So this is my first review, just bare with me, it will be short.
I simply loved this anime. I am still laughing at some of the moments in my mind. It resonated very well with me as I am also 27 and sometimes think about how easy and fun life was in high-school (though i don't know if i'd go back myself).Y
Basically it's a very funny, light and interesting story, the characters develop a little, and I would have loved to see even more of it. 
You'll find it funnier if you are a quasi-adult yourself, but i believe everyone can enjoy it. Totally recommendit!

Sincerely there is not much to say about "Re: Life" is the typical school romantic comedy anime ... let's say what is original is that its protagonist is actually an adult who could return to his teenage years and apply what he He learned throughout his life to help his schoolmates and at the same time change his own sad and defeatist personality.
As the episodes progress, we see how the relationship of the protagonist with his companions is improving more and more and he helps them recover from the typical difficulties of every teenager in school comedy anime, of course thanks to the experience heacquired throughout of their life.



An enjoyable anime but it's not the best you can find ... it's worth a look anyway!

I'm writing this review to warn off people like me.
The show made me laugh pretty damn hard in the first 3 or 4 episodes. Belly laugh, tears and all; the main character particularly had amazing, hilarious reactions.
Sadly, soon the comedy pretty much disappears and it turns into annoying highschool drama. It's the kind of drama I usually can just ignore and fast-forward through, but the drop is so intense and sudden, from the good comedy to the stupid teenagers with their nonsense, that I have to rate the anime poorly due to what I'll have to call false advertisement.
Maybe I am simply too old totolerate that crap, but in case you think you are too, either stay away from ReLIFE or watch only until somebody yells in a serious tone for some dumb reason, then you better stop and move on to something else.

As for me I do agree with most of the comment "it has not much story" but that's if you only watched the anime as for me yes true the anime was quite boring and most of it was just character building and never felt like an ending but if you read the manga it is way better than the anime. It has a point to all the build up, the characters that has been going through this build up felt like it has more use in the manga than the anime.
Same for the art the art style for the anime was quite mediocre itdoesn't have the same feel to it's manga witch had very good art work. You could very easily see the difference in art work between the two.\n\n
Overall for me if you are a person that are giving ReLife a try please consider that the manga has more story better artwork but still depends on what you like to do Watch or Read.

If you are looking for a slice of life anime with great humor and plot, don't bother looking any further, THIS IS IT! ReLife's main plot revolves around a failed 27 years old adult (Arata Kaizaki) who gets a chance to get his 17 years old appearance back and gets back to high school on his senior year.
Now, I've put years between today and my high school days, but I think the majority of us who are now an integral part of society with a 9 to 5 job, have found ourselves longing for those high school days! This is exactly what Arata gets todo.


PROS:

Now have you ever thought about what getting back into your senior year entails? Well the writers of ReLife have, and boy are they seriously stop on! This anime is filled with humor and pretty much anybody can sympathize with the main character. you have typical classroom/anime characters as well as characters who fall off the stereotypical wagon. These two types however still carry much depth and their backstories are well spread out throughout the anime. Many anime will take a whole episode or half of it to give you a sob story about a character. ReLife doesn't do this, ReLife gives you enough information in a short amount of time in order for you to get the picture and moves on to better things.


This anime got me hooked from the second episode, and I have already re-watched it twice. that's how fun it is! It's light, yet has some drama. It's fun but does portray some serious topics. And the plot is just extremely well thought out and complex enough to make the anime last three or four seasons without leaving any unanswered questions by the end of the last season. Frankly ReLife has brought me joy and laughter all the way and I can't think of any other anime of the genre that has entertained me as much.


CONS:

Although there isn't much to complain about in ReLife, I still found that sometimes the story was being dragged on and some people did things way too out of character for them. I did argue with myself that it must be due to hormones and that teenagers do stupid things so who cares. Also, the anime ends with only 13 episodes so that really blows!


MISC:

The anime is very well drawn and I did enjoy the opening and ending as well as the little skits at the end of each episode.


All in all, ReLife is amazing and you should definitely watch it whether or not you are a fan of the genre. In fact, if you like comedy, slice of life genre, drama or romance, don't hesitate to watch this. And if you don't but want to introduce a girlfriend to the world of anime, definitely go with this one!
